body:
No reason is given for either of their bans. I've heard through the grapevine it was for "brigading" "multi-accounting" and "spam" but the first two things aren't banned by the rules that I can see and the third is entirely undefined in the rules, which seems to leave a massive hole for viewpoint-based discrimination.

I'd like someone to explain to me why posting a lot of videos of blacks violently assaulting innocent White people is spam, but broccoli posting, for example, is totally okay.

I don't know if I expect an answer, but I'd like one.

**Edit:** @Amalek and @PavementApe. No reason stated at this time for either ban.

For quicker access: +WhiteVictimsOfBlackCrime

Note: Even though both guild leaders are banned, they still appear as "active" in the guild leader list and the guild is un-siegable.

**Edit 2: It's also weird that the @-ed names of banned members don't go to their profiles. Here are those guild leaders again.**

https://ruqqus.com/@Amalek

https://ruqqus.com/@PavementApe

**EDIT 3**

I also want to mention that I posted this thread because when I tried to bring this subject up on Discord, first the subject was dragged off topic, then when I brought it up again, the Discord mods purged the chat.

post.title: I would like to know why the guild leaders of +WhiteVictimsOfBlackCrime were banned and what rules they broke according to the terms of service and content policy

body:
> and he was apparently banned for brigading

Which as I said is not apparently against any rule. (Nor is multi-accounting.)

When you invent rules out of thin air to ban people you don't like, that is called

Viewpoint-based discrimination.

The entire reason I posted this thread now is that I originally accepted "brigading" as a reason, and was rather shocked when, shortly before posting this thread, I read the rules, and saw there was no rule against it that I could find.

If it's there but under some other name or something that I missed then someone could very easily say that, and then I can edit that into the OP and be done with this thread.

This is the second or third attempt on making noise about that. This one will fail as well. You were around then, you know that user was banned for botting, brigading, spamming etc. Why being intentionally obtuse? Don’t answer, I know why.

You are entitled to have the opinions you want, as dumb as they are: just don’t use a bunch of alts to upvote yourself or downvote others or hijack all the discussions pretending your alts are just other users taking a stance (which happens to be your own), like about *everyone* does on Reddit and probably other platforms.

body: @kek. There is some racism on +WhiteVictimsofBlackCrime that I personally find truly reprehensible, but that's not relevant to why its guildmasters were banned. Please give us an answer. I personally agree with spam and multi-accounting being undesirable actions, but I still need to know what happened here. We all deserve to know. This is meant to be as close to a free speech absolutist platform as you can legally run. What did @PavementApe and @Amalek do to warrant their silencing? The future of Ruqqus genuinely hinges on these sorts of incidents being handled fairly. Give us an answer.

body:
Is there a rule against brigading? Maybe there should be but people shouldn't be banned for rules that don't exist.

What is the definition of spam? Some bot account posting a canned message about single ladies in your area? Sure. Some guy copy and pasting his manifesto? Maybe, but you should at least get a warning.
body_html:

post.body:
No reason is given for either of their bans. I've heard through the grapevine it was for "brigading" "multi-accounting" and "spam" but the first two things aren't banned by the rules that I can see and the third is entirely undefined in the rules, which seems to leave a massive hole for viewpoint-based discrimination.

I'd like someone to explain to me why posting a lot of videos of blacks violently assaulting innocent White people is spam, but broccoli posting, for example, is totally okay.

I don't know if I expect an answer, but I'd like one.

**Edit:** @Amalek and @PavementApe. No reason stated at this time for either ban.

I'd like someone to explain to me why posting a lot of videos of blacks violently assaulting innocent White people is spam, but broccoli posting, for example, is totally okay.

I don't know if I expect an answer, but I'd like one.

**Edit:** @Amalek and @PavementApe. No reason stated at this time for either ban.

For quicker access: +WhiteVictimsOfBlackCrime
